info.name: InsightIQ REST API overview
info.description:
InsightIQ 5.x supports public-facing REST APIs that provide similar functionality to the InsightIQ 4.x command-line interfaces.

The URI structure for the InsightIQ REST API is:

```
/insightiq/rest/<component>/v1/<resource>

 ```

The following table describes the reporting component and its resources.

Table 1. Resources in the InsightIQ 5.x REST API

| Component | Description | Resources |  |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  |  | **Name** | **Description** |
| `security-iam` | Manages PowerScale clusters that InsightIQ is monitoring. | `auth/login` `auth/logout` `auth/session` |  |
| `clustermanager` | Manages authentication and sessions. | `clusters` |  |
| `reporting` | Accesses and exports InsightIQ reports | `filters` | Filters for FSA or performance reports |
|  |  | `fsa` | FSA reports |
|  |  | `reports` | Performance reports |
|  |  | `timeseries` | Used to export performance reports |

---

## Find more Information on:

[PowerScale InsightIQ - Info Hub | Dell US](https://www.dell.com/support/kbdoc/en-us/000220129/powerscale-insightiq-info-hub?msockid=34d4f342a7486e252ff1e677a6486f6e)

[Dell PowerScale InsightIQ 5.2.0 Administration Guide | Dell US](https://www.dell.com/support/manuals/en-us/powerscale-insight-iq/iiq_pub_insightiq_admin_guide_5_2/add-a-powerscale-cluster-to-insightiq?guid=guid-2fd67289-a402-42a9-9466-c2d23f87bbc5&lang=en-us)

[Dell PowerScale InsightIQ 5.2.0 User Guide | Dell US](https://www.dell.com/support/manuals/en-us/powerscale-insight-iq/iiq_pub_insightiq_user_guide_5_2/export-a-performance-report?guid=guid-b3db20be-af13-4a43-b030-53774315d5ec&lang=en-us)

item.name: Authentication and session management

request.description:
Start an InsightIQ REST API session.

This API creates the following for the user:

1. A new cookie (JWT token) in the Set-Cookie header as insightiq_auth=
    
2. A new x-csrf-token in the x-csrf-token header

Get information about a session.

The API gets a session or validates the session. You must pass the session token and x-csrf-token as input. If the tokens are valid, the API validates the tokens and returns a response.
Log out from an InsightIQ REST API session.

item.description:
IIQ5.x REST API relys on a session based auhentication process. The `security-iam` section provides operations to authenticate to the API server and manage API sessions.

Table 1. Authentication APIs

| Operation | Method and URI |
| --- | --- |
| Authenticate and create a session. | `POST /insightiq/rest/security-iam/v1/auth/login/` |
| Get session information. | `GET /insightiq/rest/security-iam/v1/auth/session/` |
| Delete a session. | `POST /insightiq/rest/security-iam/v1/auth/logout/` |

request.description: Log out from an InsightIQ REST API session.
Log out from an InsightIQ REST API session.

item.name: Cluster Management

request.description: Add a PowerScale cluster for InsightIQ to monitor.
Add a PowerScale cluster for InsightIQ to monitor.
Get information and status about the PowerScale clusters that InsightIQ is monitoring. The output includes the cluster ID (`guid`).
Get information and status about the PowerScale clusters that InsightIQ is monitoring. The output includes the cluster ID (`guid`).

This API removes a PowerScale cluster from InsightIQ.

`DELETE /insightiq/rest/clustermanager/v1/clusters/<GUID>`

item.description:
You can add, remove, and get the status of the PowerScale clusters that InsightIQ is monitoring. Table 1. Cluster management APIs | Operation | Method and URI | | --- | --- | | Add a PowerScale cluster to InsightIQ. | `POST /insightiq/rest/clustermanager/v1/clusters` | | Get the status and the
of the PowerScale clusters that InsightIQ is monitoring. | `GET /insightiq/rest/clustermanager/v1/clusters` | | Remove a PowerScale cluster from InsightIQ. | `DELETE /insightiq/rest/clustermanager/v1/clusters/` |

item.name: Filters

request.description: List breakouts associated with Performance or FSA reports, choose the `filter_type` in `Query Params`

item.description:
Get a list of valid filters for each type of report. There are separate filter lists for Performance Reporting and File System Analytics. The `filter_type` values are `FSA` or `PERF`. Table 1. Summary of filter APIs | Operation | Method and URI | | --- | --- | | List breakouts associated with Performance or FSA reports | `GET https://:8000/insightiq/rest/reporting/v1/filters/ \ types?filter_type=FSA`

`GET https://:8000/insightiq/rest/reporting/v1/filters/ \ types?filter_type=PERF` | | Get a list of possible values for a given filter rule. | `GET https://:8000/insightiq/rest/reporting/v1/filters/get_all_match_values \ ?rule_name=&cluster=&rsid=` | The API `GET .../filters/types` gets a list of possible breakouts. A graph may have specific filters applicable to it. This API gets the following: - The label of the filter - The Advanced Filters section presents information about the filter values, such as: - Whether the filter has values that the `get_all_match_values` API can list - Whether you must manually add a value for a filter and then apply it The API `GET .../filters/get_all_match_values` gets a list of possible values for a given filter rule. The list appears under value in Advanced Filters. The FSA Result Set ID (`rsid`) and cluster are required only for FSA-specific filters.

item.name: Performance

request.description:
Get a list of data element types used in performance reports.

The API GET `.../reports/data-element-types` shows data element types, module types (chart, table, and so on), the group the data element belongs to ( `performance`, `fsa`, `quota`, and so on), the filters that are applicable for a given chart, and the keys that are associated with a given chart.
Download a given report in CSV Format.

query.description: Applicable Filters: lnn, nodepool, tier, protocol

request.description: Retrieve a given performance report as JSON. Has the data used for the graph in IIQ only.
Retrieve breakout data for a given report, in json format.
Retrieve breakout data for a given report, in json format.
Retrieve breakout data for a given report, in json format.
Retrieve breakout data for a given report, in json format.

item.description:
The Performace Report API. Table 1. Summary of Performance report APIs | Operation | Method and URI | | --- | --- | | Get the data element types and keys that identify performance reports.
NOTE:For a table of chart names and keys, see "Get performance key". | GET 8000/insightiq/rest/reporting/v1/reports/data-element-types | | Export a performance report for a specified cluster and time range. | GET /insightiq/rest/reporting/v1/timeseries/download_data?... | | Get a performance report in its native format. This is divided into two API Calls: | | | Get Graph data, the data used to build the graphs in IIQ. | GET /insightiq/rest/reporting/v1/timeseries/graph_data?... | | Get breakout data, the timeseries data for a given data breakout. eg. by Node etc. | GET /insightiq/rest/reporting/v1/timeseries/breakout_data?... | ## Permission to view the Partitioned Performance report If you have trouble viewing a Partitioned Performance report for a PowerScale cluster, there is a required configuration missing on the PowerScale cluster. To view the Partitioned Performance report for a PowerScale cluster in InsightIQ, a PowerScale administrator must configure an additional privilege for the `insightiq` user account on the PowerScale cluster. The `insightiq` user account is a default user on PowerScale clusters. 1. In the PowerScale OneFS web interface, create a new role. 2. Add the existing `insightiq` file system user under this new role. 3. Under **Privileges**, grant read permission to Performance: Configure performance resource accounting. 4. Click **Submit**.

item.name: FSA

request.description: Get the result set ID that is associated with an FSA report. The result set ID is required to export an FSA report.

## Export an FSA report. Use the `/insightiq/rest/reporting/v1/fsa/download_data` API with the GET method and the following parameters. Table 1. Parameters | Parameter | Description | | --- | --- | | `cluster` | Specify the PowerScale cluster id (`guid`). | | `rsid` | Specify the result set ID by which the FSA report is identified. | | `chart_type` | Specify the chart type for the exported FSA report. The supported values for
`chart_type` are:

\- `directories-browser`This value requires an additional parameter. Specify `lin=x`, where `x` is the lin level. The default lin is 0 for the root of the `ifs` file system ( `/ifs`).

\- `fsa-histogram`This value requires an additional parameter. Specify
q with one of the following values:
\- `ctime`
\- `phys_size`
\- `log_size`

\- `grid-top-files`This value requires an additional parameter. Specify
q with one of the following values:
\- `top_files`
\- `top_dirs`

\- `grid-top-dirs`This value requires an additional parameter. Specify
`q` with one of the following values:
\- `top_files`
\- `top_dirs` | | `q` | Use this parameter in combination with
`chart_type` values. See the previous descriptions for instances where the
`q` parameter is required. | | `comp_rsid` | Use this parameter to compare the current report with another report. Specify the result set ID of the report to compare against. | | `breakout_by` | Specify the type of breakout to apply to the exported data. See
Table 2 below. | | `breakout_limit` | Specify a limit for the breakout. | | `filter` | Specify the filter to apply to exported data. To specify a filter, you must specify the breakout that the filter applies to. See
Table 3 below. | Table 2. Breakout values | Breakout description | Breakout value | | --- | --- | | Accessed Time | `atime` | | Directory | `directory` | | File Extension | `path_ext` | | Logical Size | `log_size` | | Changed Time | `ctime` | | Node Pool | `node_pool` | | Physical Size | `phys_size` | | Tier | `tier` | | User Attribute | `attribute` | Table 3. Filter values | Breakout description | Breakout value | Filter values | | --- | --- | --- | | Accessed Time | `atime` | The following values are valid:
\-60
Specifies 0:00:00 - 0:01:00
\-3600
Specifies 0:01:00 - 1:00:00
\-86400
Specifies 1:00:00 - 1 day
\-604800
Specifies 1 day - 7 days
\-2592000
Specifies 7 days - 30 days
\-5184000
Specifies 30 days - 60 days
\-7776000
Specifies 60 days - 90 days
\-15552000
Specifies 90 days - 180 days
\-31536000
Specifies 180 days - 365 days
\-63072000
Specifies 365 days - 730 days
Infinity
Specifies 730 days - Infinity
For example:
`atime:-3600` | | Directory | `directory` | The path of a directory starting with
/ifs in the following format:

`directory:/ifs/data/media` | | File Extension | `path_ext` | The name of a file extension in the following format:
`path_ext:txt` | | Logical Size | `log_size` | A range of sizes in the following format:

`-`

0
Specifies 0 byes - 8 KB
8192
Specifies 8 KB - 128 KB
131072
Specifies 128 KB - 1 MB
1048576
Specifies 1 MB - 10 MB
10485760
Specifies 10 MB - 100 MB
104857600
Specifies 100 MB - 1 GB
1073741824
Specifies 1 GB - 10 GB
10737418240
Specifies 10 GB - 100 GB
107374182400
Specifies 100 GB - 1 TB
1099511627776
Specifies 1 TB - Infinity
For example:
`log_size:1GB-10GB` | | Changed Time | `ctime` | The following values are valid:
\-60
Specifies 0:00:00 - 0:01:00
\-3600
Specifies 0:01:00 - 1:00:00
\-86400
Specifies 1:00:00 - 1 day
\-604800
Specifies 1 day - 7 days
\-2592000
Specifies 7 days - 30 days
\-5184000
Specifies 30 days - 60 days
\-7776000
Specifies 60 days - 90 days
\-15552000
Specifies 90 days - 180 days
\-31536000
Specifies 180 days - 365 days
\-63072000
Specifies 365 days - 730 days
Infinity
Specifies 730 days - Infinity
For example:
`ctime:-3600` | | Node Pool | `node_pool` | The name of a node pool:

`node_pool:pool`

NOTE:This filter option is available only if you monitor a PowerScale cluster that is running OneFS 8.0 or later. | | Physical Size | `phys_size` | A range of sizes in the following formats:

`-`

0
Specifies 0 byes - 8 KB
8192
Specifies 8 KB - 128 KB
131072
Specifies 128 KB - 1 MB
1048576
Specifies 1 MB - 10 MB
10485760
Specifies 10 MB - 100 MB
104857600
Specifies 100 MB - 1 GB
1073741824
Specifies 1 GB - 10 GB
10737418240
Specifies 10 GB - 100 GB
107374182400
Specifies 100 GB - 1 TB
1099511627776
Specifies 1 TB - Infinity
For example:
`phys_size:1GB-10GB` | | Tier | `tier` | The name of a tier. For example:
`tier:tier_name`

NOTE:This filter option is available only if you monitor a cluster that is running OneFS 8.0 or later | | User Attribute | `attribute` | The name of a user attribute defined on the cluster. All characters are valid. |

item.description:
You can get the result set ID for a defined report, and then export the report.

Table 1. Summary of FSA report APIs

| Operation | Method and URI |
| --- | --- |
| Get the result set IDs. | `GET https://:8000/insightiq/rest/reporting/v1/fsa/clusters//fsa/resultsets/published` |
| Export an FSA report. | `GET https://:8000/insightiq/rest/reporting/v1/fsa/download_data?cluster=&rsid=` |
